name: Eaton Chelsea

reviews.text: Do not stay here. The hotel is very run down for standard rooms. If you complain you may get a better room but save your self the head ache and go somewhere else.
reviews.title: Old rundown hotel

reviews.text: Went to the pub one night and had the worst service that I can recall anywhere. This hotel clearly markets to student groups so it was very noisy both in the halls and outside noise from Younge Street.
reviews.title: Best Hotel EVER

reviews.text: The staff in the lobby were the only highlight of this visit.
reviews.title: Great Location but needs an extreme makeover

reviews.text: I will be staying at any other hotel next visit to Toronto.
reviews.title: It's the small things that make the difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the best hotel i have ever been to. every body was so friendly and there was tons of activities for my parents and my sister and i. the rooms were spectacular with great views. the pool was amazing and had a huge and awesome water slide that was pitch black. the food was delicious and this is a hotel that i will keep on coming to every year!
reviews.title: Amazing value in the heart of the city

reviews.text: Staff is always super. Very friendly, and helpful. Room has everything we need. Location is superb. Close to shopping, and theatres. We feel very safe at the Delta Chelsea. It is our hotel in Toronto.
reviews.title: We love the Delta Chelsea.

reviews.text: I tired to like the Delta Chelsea Inn, I really did. Having had a bad stay here several years ago I was willing to give it another shot - this time booked on the "Signature Club Foor".
reviews.title: If the Signature rooms are this bad, I can't imagine what the cheaper rooms are like.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I found was drab decor, stark bathrooms and balconies in disrepair. The only good thing this hotel has going for it is the location off Yonge Street, the view from the higher floors and a nice lobby.
reviews.title: Great location and staff

reviews.text: The room - drab, underwhelming and our room # 2481 scrawled in black ink on the duvet for us to see. Musty smelling, humid, and when we opened the balcony for some air we were afraid to step out on it, rusty rebar, chipping cement and peeling paint, it looked like it would fall off the building at any moment and this is a CLUB LEVEL room.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: Bathroom stark, like a dormitory.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, but improvements needed

reviews.text: My 11 year old son and I stayed here over a weekend and the location was just perfect. Super close to Eaton Centre, Cineplex, and about a 20 minute walk to Chinatown, Air Canada Centre and the CN Tower. Rooms are also 3 star at best and the pool area is tiny for such a large hotel. Great hotel if you don't plan on staying there much!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: We appreciate honesty in hotel star ratings and this hotel, in our opinion, is really a 3.5 star. We have stayed in Toronto many times and We like to stay in that region, near Eaton Centre, where we can easily walk to everywhere. I had a special rate for our room for our family of 4. When we arrived, we found a very large and wonderful lobby, with lots of exits to access downtown Toronto.
reviews.title: Great lobby, pool/workout area, but outdated rooms.

reviews.text: We checked in with a cordial and efficient staff and got on the elevator that has one different color for each group of floors. In our room, we were a bit disappointed, but despite being a little outdated it suited us nicely and was clean (housekeeping staff always very friendly),with comfy bed and pillows, good size flat screen tv and coffee/tea facilities(no fridge in room).
reviews.title: great location and good family hotel with best Indian buffet ever at lunchtime.

reviews.text: EXCELLENT pool and workout area on top of the roof, with separate rooms for cardio, weightlifting, stretching, etc (neat and well equipped, but a little warm).
reviews.title: Great location in Downtown Toronto, great value
3.5 star hotel? Not really.
reviews.text: The Market Place restaurant seemed to be good, but after seeing the prices, we preferred to go out to have meals.

reviews.title: Smoker? Don't stay here!!
reviews.text: The lobby is fantastic, the staff is friendly and the Consierge is more than ready and willing to find an answer for any questions you may have... But if you need a smoke like many Canadians do, do NOT stay here...

reviews.title: Excellent if you can get a deal
reviews.text: Part of an enjoyable stay for me when I travel is the ambiance in the room. Granted smoking is a non-attractive habit, I have fallen victim to the occasional nicotine fix and like to have a cigarette or two in my hotel room... Now I'm not too sure how the other rooms would fare... but the smoking rooms are a nostalgic step back to what a 5 star room looked like back in the mid 70's... The decor was WAY out of date, the bed was as hard as a rock, there was no internet connection and the couch and curves in the seats from the thousands of people who have parked their arses on it...
I have stayed in other hotels downtown TO that were the same price and their smoking rooms were just as classy and up-to-date as their non-smoking rooms...
reviews.title: Delta Chelsea Hotel Horror
Great Family Hotel
reviews.text: We got a deal at $99 in October 2004. Great location right in downtown. Pool was very nice, a little small but that's pretty standard. Nice hot tub too.

reviews.title: Weekend Getaway
reviews.text: We actually ended up upgrading to a better suite which ended up being like $135 or something. It was on some special floor and had turn-down service and a few other things. Not worth it at all. If you can get into this hotel for $99 or anything else which is cheap, stay here, it's pretty nice. But don't bother upgrading at all to a better suite, it's not much difference.
Booked into this hotel after being disappointed with Bond Place. Check in desk were very helpful and told us about the hotel.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: The help yourself restaurant was good, although the Hot breakfast wasn't that hot.
reviews.title: Excellent service
happy new year
reviews.text: We were put on the 15th floor overlooking Younge Street, great view.

reviews.title: a great birthday
reviews.text: We had a paper every day and the cleaning staff were prompt.

reviews.title: Still a good hotel
reviews.text: This is an ideal location for visiting toronto, subway, path and restaurants in touching distance of hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I purchased a deal through LivingSocial and after reading the reviews on this site, I decided to buy the upgraded package (renovated room and access to lounge) and sign up for Delta's loyalty card, which were without doubt the best decision!
reviews.title: Renovated rooms are worth the extra money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The check in process was fine. The room was nice, the bed was very comfortable and there was no noise from the construction nearby. On the negative side, the curtains were ragged, the bathtub was old (not very appealing) and there wasn't a brochure of services available at the hotel (no extension numbers, hours of service for services, etc).
reviews.title: The dowagers slip is showing
Sad Hotel
reviews.text: The signature lounge was good, there was a nice variety of hors d'oeuvres, the staff were pleasant, breakfast was good and best of all, it wasn't too crowded or loud.

We had the prix fixe at the B33 restaurant. The food was ok, and in particular, the spaghetti was extremely oily. The best part was the cheesecake. I wish there had been more choices to choose from (or al least different) without having to pay more and I was glad the menu was part of the deal we got because I wasn't too happy with it.
reviews.title: Service/Location and NOT the age/decor make this hotel!

reviews.text: In summary, as other people have mentioned, I would definitely recommend to upgrade to a renovated room because based on the reviews from people here, it will be a very different experience.
reviews.title: Great Potential/Location -Work Needed

reviews.text: Overall this hotel is fine. The location is absolutely perfect, within walking distance of the main shopping strip and the museums. But you should be warned that they cater to families. I went on a holiday weekend alone and could not believe the number of screaming kids in the lobby. It never ended! The lines for the elevators was constant. Service was very good but try to avoid ordering your meals in your rooms as the food was only "eh."
reviews.title: Great for Families, Singles? Not so much
march break
reviews.text: I am guessing during the week it is a little more quiet. The hotel is a fine deal money wise and the adults only pool/gym was a nice break from the kiddies. The Bistro downstairs makes a good steak and a yummy Ceasar salad. Rooms are good sized but the decor is more than just a little dated. Bathroom tubs are tiny but clean.

reviews.title: No Parking at the Delta Chelsea,Downtown toronto
reviews.text: That said, the location again is perfect. It is in the heart of downtown but very safe. The views are nice and the staff is very pleasant.

reviews.title: A Real Zoo
reviews.text: I was at the Delta Chelsea last week as well. Friendly Staff and amazing customer service!! It was quite busy and plenty of kids running around. I believe that the reason for this was that it was March/Spring Break and every parent in and out of the city and their kids were booked in that hotel. Since they have an indoor waterslide....that would explain it. I stay there on business a lot and it can be quiet a lot of times. Overall it's a hotel that I would come back to. Never boring!!

Our stay at the Delta Chelsea was ok except for the fact that when we arrived we were instructed to go around back because we couldn't park underground because we have a mini van. The Valet parking attendant said that there was no problem with the underground parking . After searching the entire lot there was nothing available and by the time we got above ground our van was over heating. My husband went in and complained and was told that there were lots around the hotel that we could use and that they would deduct the automatic parking fee from our bill. There was no apology.
reviews.title: Staff at wrong hotel??!??

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on Saturday, June 15th. We are a family of 4 - my daughter and I went to the Taylor Swift concert while my husband and son stayed at the hotel. The City was extremely busy with all of the events going on so hotels were filling quickly. We had stayed at the Delta when the kids were very young (they are 12 and 11 now) and not much had changed. I knew ahead of time that the lobby was undergoing construction so that was not a suprise. I had called the morning of our arrival to put in a second request for a cot, and was assured I would have one. When we arrived at approximately 2:30, I was told that our room had been upgraded to a room with 3 double beds - which I was very pleased with (no arguing about who woud sleep on the cot). Unfortunately the room was not ready and I was told to come back between 3 and 3:30. At 3:30 the room was still not ready. At 4:00, after requesting access to the pool so the kids could swim, I called from the pool and asked if it was ready. I was told that it was not because of my "special request" for a room with 3 dbl beds. I quickly clarified that I had only requested a cot - the 3 dbl bed room was THEIR idea. And they still could not tell me when the room was ready. By 4:30 I put my husband on the phone and a very perky Ashley told him the room was ready, so we gathered all of our belongings from the pool area and headed upstairs. We were in the old part of the hotel, with no balcony or fridge. But the 3 dbl beds were definitely better than a cot and 2 dbls, and the room was bigger. The beds are extremely comfortable and you are given an abundance of pillows. Kids liked the free Wi-Fi. The bathroom was outdated but that was to be expected. All in all, the room suited our needs and we were not disappointed. We would stay here again for one night if the need arose. Two nights would likely be too much. The location is PERFECT and with Young being closed to traffic that night we enjoyed walking around to see what was happening in the very lively downtown.
reviews.title: Met our needs!

reviews.text: This was our second stay at the hotel and I must say it was a great experience.Room was very nice,comfortable and clean. Housekeeping was excellent,towels etc fresh each day.Had a small issue with the toilet but staff fixed it fast.Although the hotel is going under major renos the front desk staff was very helpful and courteous. The food service was good with lots of meal selections.Will stay here again!!
reviews.title: Stay

reviews.text: My colleague and I stayed at the Delta Chelsea last week. The hotel is undergoing what it calls 'exciting changes' but what we felt was a cover-up of mostly very old interior and outdated facilities.
reviews.title: Rennovation notwithstanding, the staff attitude was a complete turn off

reviews.text: The entire lobby is under tarpaulins and there is heavy work happening everywhere. Though aesthetically not pleasing to the eye the work never really is disruptive.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: What we found appalling through our stay was the attitude of the staff. We were booked in Club Rooms and though our reservation was done at least 2 months prior to our arrival, we were not once advised of the extensive work that was being done. On arrival we were informed that as the rooms were not ready we would have to wait (we arrived at 1400hrs) at least 1hr if not more. We requested if we could get rooms earlier as we had meetings and had been on the road for the better part of two weeks but were summarily informed by the uppity front office representative that the hotel was sold out and that we would be lucky to get rooms even at 1500hrs. The hotel had over 1000 rooms and housekeeping would not be able to turn them around so quickly. (I'd like to say here that the housekeeping staff in the hotel was the warmest, most accommodating and as I saw it the most hardworking).
reviews.title: Extensive renovation work......
Good value
reviews.text: Stayed here for a few days while in TO to see some baseball. We had an upgraded room which was worth the extra - my only complaint about the room was the horrendously noisy exhaust fan. The room cleaning staff did an excellent job as the room was immaculately clean every day when they were done. The hotel staff were all very helpful but I would agree with other reviews about the service in their monarch lounge. (They need better servers in that lounge for sure.) All in all it was a good hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the DC this past weekend for one night. Parked underground at $25, pretty inexpensive for TO. There was a huge line-up at check-in but my husband checked in at the priviledge desk because he is a member and they upgraded us to a queen room with a wet bar and fridge on the 16th floor. Room are small unless you get a suite.
reviews.title: Delta Chelsea-A true 3+ star
Okay, rather dated
reviews.text: Room was $130.00, great price. They asked us if we would like late check-out (no) and if we wanted it later, no problem. Really good service. There is a "robot" in the lobby entertaining the kids. It's a great family hotel. Didn't use the pool this time. they have a family pool and adult pool.

I always inspect the room for cleanliness and sanitize the light switches, remote etc. It was clean except for blood on the toilet flusher (yuk). The bed and pillows were very comfy. Had a balcony that needed a lot of work but it was nice to open the balcony door.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, very kid-friendly

reviews.text: We ate at the overpriced cafeteria. Food was OK. Breakfast was better. They had small bottles of wine for $10, but you couldn't take them up to your room or buy more than one at a time.
reviews.title: Great value, great location, great amenities

reviews.text: Nothing was enough to make me not go back but also nothing to make me one running back...
reviews.title: Average...

reviews.text: Good
reviews.title: Disappointingly average hotel

reviews.text: -location (close to Eatons centre and lots of food options)
reviews.title: Shabby, Shabby and more Shabby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -comfortable bed
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: - very friendly house keeping staff
reviews.title: Not worth it anymore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got home from Toronto and a stay at the Delta Chelsea. The best thing about it is the location which is great for anything downtown - theatre, tours, hospital stays, shopping. We booked through the hotel and got a king-size bed (very comfy) for $123 a night. The parking was below in the garage and cost $29 for the night (For people who complain about the parking cost, try parking anywhere for 24 hours in downtown Toronto for less!). Sure the hotel is older but they are working on it, and the staff were very hospitable. Also remember that it is a huge, massive hotel of 1590 rooms so renovating is an enormous, ongoing job. We will definitely stay there again!!
reviews.title: Perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms that have not been renovated yet are in poor, tired shape (the mattress and linens were nice, however). Very much a dissapointment. Otherwise the hotel is ok; the adult pool area is nice, and the location can't be beat. 7/10
reviews.title: the location can't be beat

reviews.text: Booked through Hotwire and although we booked for three adults, we're booked a room with one queen bed. The front desk staff were great and gave us a corner room with a pullout for no extra charge! It was in the older, not enovated part (room 2352) but was nice, clean and quiet.
reviews.title: Great stay! A+ service!

reviews.text: Staff were great. I was walking down the hall with my ice bucket and a housekeeper asked me if I knew where the ice machine was and took me there when I said no. Above and beyond service by several staff.
reviews.title: Some Good, Some Bad

reviews.text: Good location, market garden restaurant for breakfast was great! Overall a good stay and we would definitely stay again!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I spent 3 nights at the Delta in June (10-13) while on business. While my corporate rate was great I'd have to say my stay was only mediocre. The Delta is tired. Rooms are very dated and in need of a major retrofit. Windows are paper thin and every siren that went by it sounded as if my balcony door was wide open. The rooms were clean and maid service was great. The lobby is undergoing some major construction and some mornings were a gong show trying to get out. Daily parking is ridiculous at $29/day. Maybe that's the norm in Toronto but keep that in mind when figuring out your budget. Hopefully new ownership will turn the Delta around.
reviews.title: Don't Expect Much

reviews.text: An assistant reserved rooms - 4 rooms for 4 people.....3 standard rooms and 1 suite with a conference table so we could work. Now the hotel says we booked a 3 room suite (only 2 bedrooms) and 1 stand alone room......however 3 people are paying average $200 a night and the suite is at $300 and all 4 people got separate reservations in each of our names. They tried to tell me that I was sharing a room with one of the others.....then backed down and said I have a pull out couch....but of course it would take 3 men to move the heavy coffee table to even think about pulling the couch out!! Not happy and the Front Desk Manager says the only thing she can do is charge me for a 5th room or give me a 1 bedroom suite where we don't have a conference table to set our computers on........ Don't recommend you stay here......also under construction!!
reviews.title: Ended up on a couch paying for a suite

reviews.text: for starters.. yes the hotel is basically a construction zone.. the entire lobby is under tarps.. but who hangs out in the lobby... my room.. 1428.. seemed updated with a flat screen tv and was very clean.. the balcony was a nice touch.. although there was a construction site right across the street.. but since i stayed from friday to monday morning.. there was no construction noise.. but i could see this being a major problem during the week.. for the price i paid through expedia( which was about 90 bucks a night) it was well worth it, and i would reccomend it to anyone.. it was within walking distance to the hockey hall of fame and the rogers centre and mass transit was right up the block.. and the concierge staff was great....
reviews.title: toronto weekend

reviews.text: We stayed at the delta chelsea when we had appts at Sick Kids for our children/we got the family suite room...and LOVED IT. 2 bedrooms, a kitchen and great extras for the kids! They even had a little play area for our three kids. Was an awesome experience/and we were treated amazingly by the staff! Thanks again!!
reviews.title: great for families!

reviews.text: On a recent trip to Toronto, stayed at the Delta Chelsea - now changed to the Eaton Chelsea. It was an excellent value. Great rooms, good size, good restaurant, super morning coffee shop and right in the heart of downtown Toronto. Walked to the Eaton Centre for some shopping, to Yorkville for some dining and to the Chinese district for a great foot massage - it's the perfect location. The lobby was torn up with renovations but if you can visualize - it's going to look fabulous! Would stay again.
reviews.title: It's great value

reviews.text: I was in Toronto for the weekend to see Taylor Swift and shopping with my cousin and we had a room at the hotel. The Pros I would say overall it was good it is a great location, friendly staff and clean. The Cons or dislikes are it was extremely noisy when we checked in having a hard time to hear the staff at check in. The renovations in the lobby made an already confusing multiple doors more hard to figure out. Even though it is nice to be able to access the different streets. When we checked we were surprised that there was not bar fridge in the room. We also noticed the soap holder on the wall in the bathroom was off the wall. We did have it fixed a short time later. The other problem is that only 1/2 the blue series of elevators was running which meant for a really long wait all the time. Excellent recommendation on restaurant on Elm Street called Donatella.
reviews.title: June 14-16, 2013

reviews.text: The hotel was in a great downtown Toronto location. The room was clean and free internet was nice. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was ok. The only thing I didn't like was the wait for the elevators. It was 10-15 at times. I stayed on 21st floor so stairs was not an option. It is not the hotel fault the elevator mechanics were on strike in the whole province.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: Weekend getaway with toddlers - our grandchildren. Comfortable beds, fair sized room with drawers for all we need to unpack with little ones, pool with water-slide for older kids is great fun and the hot pool is a great way for little ones to unwind. Large play centre is located just outside the pool area and with toys, an aquarium, and two live bunnies to pet, playtime can be lots of fun.
reviews.title: Great place for a weekend stay with toddlers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Too bad the computer didn't seem to be working and some toys need to be replaced and updated but still there is enough to keep little ones busy for awhile. An update in the play area would be a great help to travellers with little ones.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: Take note that renovations are underway but we weren't inconvienced.
reviews.title: Central location

reviews.text: As a corporate customer I was really disappointed with my recent stay. When I went to check into my room it was changed from a queen size bed to two double beds...really great since it was just me staying in the room. Later on I called the front desk to request a late check out...rather than checking out at 11am I asked if I could check out 1 hour later since I had an important business meeting. Of course I was told "NO" because they were going to be busy. Thanks Delta for making me drag my suitcase and belongings into the boardroom at work. Lastly my room appeared to be upgraded but even still there were stains on the carpet; the furniture looked weathered; the bathroom was poorly drywalled and painted; and the temperature was near impossible to change. On the bright side at least it is in a good location but that's not enough for me to come back!
reviews.title: Thanks for the downgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived very late (around midnight), but were welcomed warmly. The staff were amazing throughout our stay, helping with travel questions, and tourist options and tickets as well as having cabs quickly available.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.text: Room service was quick and well presented though the food wasn't anything fantastic (we had pizza and drinks that first night. It was pretty bland, but filling).
reviews.title: Decent hotel, bit outdated

reviews.text: The buffet was handy and there are plenty of places to go to eat nearby (I heartily recommend Wanda's Waffles a block away on Younge St - the belgian waffles and crepes are both delicious!).
reviews.title: Nice people, desperately needs renovating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 2170 which had a king bed, small desk and a sitting chair. The room was clean and had enough room to move around comfortably. The bed was fantastic and we slept really well. Being able to adjust the air conditioning was handy and we had a slight view of the CN tower (lower half was blocked by another building) from the window.
reviews.title: Busy Downtown Hotel - Great Amenities, Great Location

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights in this hotel last week as part of a package holiday and we were a bit worried when we read some of the reviews but we needn't have been concerned.The service was first class from the check-in desk to the housekeeping staff who had a pleasant greeting for us when we met on the corridor.
reviews.title: Big but still provides the personal touch

reviews.text: The room was spacious and well furnished and the bathroom was large and well stocked with nice toiletries and big towels were plentiful.
reviews.title: An excellent base in Toronto!
Delta Provided Everything We Needed!
reviews.text: Breakfast in the Market Place restaurant provided a good variety for all tastes and very good value also.

reviews.title: Great Business Location
reviews.text: Steve,the concierge,was especially helpful in arranging tours and theatre tickets and had exquisite good manners.

reviews.title: Not worth the money!!
reviews.text: The Delta certainly provides the personal touch and was a great central base for our first visit to beautiful Toronto.

The facilities at first glance seemed great. I arrived to my room and everything looked well-enough, the one unbearable quality was the awful wet carpet old feet smell. It was enough to knock you over. This is my second stay at this hotel, neither visit has left me impressed. I wouldn't have chosen this place for a second visit, I was unfortunately put up here this time.
reviews.title: Horrible smell in room 640

reviews.text: My recommendation would be to head to the Westin Harbour Castle or the Sheraton Centre for a guaranteed good stay.
reviews.title: Unbelievably bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our toilet was making strange gurgling sounds during the night and in the morning it overflowed , flooding the bathroom and adjoining carpet. Two calls (the second one answered very rudely) and 40 minutes later, a staff member finally showed up to look at the problem. He called for a member of the housekeeping staff to bring a mop for the floor. Ten minutes later she showed up with some towels which just swished the mess around. The floor was never mopped or disinfected (did I mention that the toilet had overflowed)? Because we hadn't been able to get into the bathroom for an hour we were late and missed our train that morning. At checkout when asked about our stay I told the staff member about our predicament and then it seemed that she couldn't wait to get rid of me since I didn't have glowing things to say. No apology or explanation for the situation was ever offered. I've stayed at this hotel plenty of times before and at other Deltas as well but this is the last time that I'll stay at any of them.
reviews.title: Improvements made - good job Delta Chelsea

reviews.text: Stayed again for hospital visit. Pleasantly surprised with grab bars added to bathroom and new furniture. Decor improved 100%. Didn't access many other services and check-in was quick though not friendly. Still great rate, location, cleanliness, bed. No complaints. Thank you and thank you Tripadvisor. The room is safer now. The only thing to keep it from a 5 star is the general age of the property and the aging bones (windows etc.)
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights while doing stuff at hospital. In walking distance of hospital and they have special rate and 1/2 price parking. I always request quiet room as I am a light sleeper. First room was to close to Younge Street and very noisy. Asked for a room change and they upgraded me to deluxe room with 2 beds. The room was very quiet first night but second night had some noisy people having fun until 4:00am so call security and then was quiet again I should have called earlier as it started at 12. The room was clean and had free internet. The beds very comfy. This hote has a outdoor lounge on 27th floor which was nice to relax on. This hotel just needs a few more things to bring it up to be the best hotel in TO for familiesI think just need to add a fridge and micro and safe and this hotel would be perfect.
reviews.title: SHABBY ROOMS

description: Centrally located in the heart of downtown, steps from amazing attractions, businesses and shopping, the Eaton Chelsea offers travellers comfortable accommodations at exceptional value. Featuring 1,590 contemporary guestrooms and suites, Eaton Chelsea is Canada's largest hotel, delivering warm and reliable service and a variety of accommodation options. All rooms are equipped with technological conveniences and amenities, including basic complimentary WiFi. Whether testing your limits in the well-appointed fitness centre, lapping up the quiet comfort of the Deck 27 indoor pool, or enjoying the Family Fun Zone heated pool with the 130 ft "Corkscrew" waterslide, Kid Centre and Club 33 Teen Lounge, Eaton Chelsea guests can choose to exercise their body, relax their mind or take advantage of the family-friendly amenities.Eaton Chelsea offers guests a broad choice of dining venues. Experience all-day dining at Market Garden, enjoy fresh local dishes at Bb 33 Bistro and Brasserie, indulge in a coffee or cocktail at the T|Bar Lounge or embrace the lively vibe in Monarchs Pub, downtown Toronto's hotspot for nightly entertainment.
